asClass.name: Torus
asClass.description:
The Torus class is used for creating a torus primitive. A torus can be seen as a doughnut.

All credits go to Tim Knipt from suite75.net who created the AS2 implementation. Original sources available at : http://www.suite75.net/svn/papervision3d/tim/as2/org/papervision3d/objects/Torus.as
asClass.shortDescription: The Torus class is used for creating a torus primitive.
asClass.author:
<author><![CDATA[ Thomas Pfeiffer ( adaption for Sandy )
 ]]></author>
<author><![CDATA[ Tim Knipt
  ]]></author>
asClass.example: To create a torus with a large radius of 250, a small radius of 80, and with default settings for the number of horizontal and vertical segments, use the following statement: <listing version="3.1"> var torus:Torus = new Torus( "theTorus", 250, 80 ); </listing>

asClass.name: Line3D
asClass.description:
The Line3D class is used for creating a line in 3D space.

The line is created by passing a comma delimited argument list containing Point3Ds.
A Line3D object can only use the WireFrameMaterial[?]
asClass.shortDescription: The Line3D class is used for creating a line in 3D space.
asClass.author: Thomas Pfeiffer - kiroukou
asClass.example: To create a line between ( x0, y0, z0 ), ( x1, y1, z1 ), ( x2, y2, z3 ), use the following statement: <listing version="3.1"> var myLine:Line3D = new Line3D( "aLine", new Point3D(x0, y0, z0), new Point3D( x1, y1, z1 ), new Point3D( x2, y2, z3 )); </listing>

A line is drawn between Point3Ds in the order they are passed. A minimum of two Point3Ds must be passed.

asClass.name: ATransformable
asClass.description:
ABSTRACT CLASS - super class for all movable objects in the object tree.

This class should not be directly instatiated, but sub classed.
The Atransformable class is resposible for scaling, rotation and translation of objects in 3D space.

Rotations and translations are performed in one of three coordinate systems or reference frames:
- The local frame which is the objects own coordinate system
- The parent frame which is the coordinate system of the object's parent, normally a TransformGroup
- The world frame which is the coordinate system of the world, the global system.

Positions, directions, translations and rotations of an ATransformable object are performed in its parent frame.
Tilt, pan and roll, are rotations around the local axes, and moveForward, moveUpwards and moveSideways are translations along local axes.
asClass.shortDescription: ABSTRACT CLASS - super class for all movable objects in the object tree.

field.name: enableEvents
field.shortDescription: Enable event handling to all the children objects that can broadcast bubbling events

field.name: enableInteractivity
field.shortDescription: Change the interactivity of all the children

field.name: useSingleContainer
field.shortDescription: Make all the Shape3D and descendants children react to this value.

method.name: addChild
method.shortDescription: Adds a new child to this node.

method.name: addEventListener
method.shortDescription: Adds a listener for the specified event.

method.name: cull
method.shortDescription: Tests this node against the frustum volume to get its visibility.

method.name: destroy
method.shortDescription: Delete this node and all its child nodes.

method.name: getChildByName
method.shortDescription: Returns the child node with the specified name.

method.name: hasParent
method.shortDescription: Tests if this node has a parent.

method.name: isParent
method.shortDescription: Tests if the node passed in the argument is parent of this node.

method.name: perform
method.shortDescription: Performs an operation on this node and all of its children.

method.name: remove
method.shortDescription: Removes this node from the node tree, saving its child nodes.

method.name: removeChildByName
method.shortDescription: Removes the child node with the specified name.

method.name: removeEventListener
method.shortDescription: Removes a listener for the specified event.

method.name: swapParent
method.shortDescription: Moves this node to another parent node.

method.name: updateBoundingVolumes
method.shortDescription: Updates the bounding volumes of this object.

constructor.name: ATransformable
constructor.description:
Creates a transformable node in the object tree of the world.

This constructor should normally not be called directly, but from a sub class.
constructor.shortDescription: Creates a transformable node in the object tree of the world.

param.name: p_sName
param.description: A string identifier for this object

method.name: getLookAt
method.description: getLookAt - obtain last value set via lookAt() method; may not be valid if other camera movement has occurred since then.
method.shortDescription: getLookAt - obtain last value set via lookAt() method; may not be valid if other camera movement has occurred since then.

method.name: getPosition
method.description:
Returns the position of this group or object.

Choose which coordinate system the returned position refers to, by passing a mode string:
The position is returned as a Point3D in one of the following:
If "local", the position is coordinates of the parent frame. If "absolute" the position is in world coordinates If "camera" the position is relative to the camera's coordinate system. Default value is "local"
method.shortDescription: Returns the position of this group or object.
method.result: The position of the group or object

method.name: initFrame
method.description:
Initiates the local coordinate system for this object.

The local coordinate system for this object is set parallell the parent system.
method.shortDescription: Initiates the local coordinate system for this object.

method.name: lookAt
method.description:
Makes this object "look at" the specified position in the parent frame.

Useful for following a moving object or a static object while this object is moving.
Normally used when this object is a camera
method.shortDescription: Makes this object "look at" the specified position in the parent frame.

param.name: p_nX
param.description: Number The x position to look at

param.name: p_nY
param.description: Number The y position to look at

param.name: p_nZ
param.description: Number The z position to look at

method.name: lookAtPoint
method.description:
The position in the parent frame this object should "look at".

Useful for following a moving object or a static object while this object is moving.
Normally used when this object is a camera
method.shortDescription: The position in the parent frame this object should "look at".

method.name: moveForward
method.description:
Translates this object along its forward Point3D ( local z ) in the parent frame.

If you imagine yourself in the world, it would be a step forward
in the direction you look, not always horizontally!
method.shortDescription: Translates this object along its forward Point3D ( local z ) in the parent frame.

method.name: moveHorizontally
method.description:
Translates this object parallel to its parent zx plane and in its forward direction.

If you imagine yourself in the world, it would be a step in the forward direction, but without changing your altitude ( constant global z ).
method.shortDescription: Translates this object parallel to its parent zx plane and in its forward direction.

method.name: moveLateraly
method.description:
Translates this object laterally in its parent frame.

This is a translation in the parent's x direction.
method.shortDescription: Translates this object laterally in its parent frame.

method.name: moveSideways
method.description:
Translates this object along its side Point3D ( local x ) in the parent frame.

If you imagine yourself in the world, it would be a step to your right or to your left
method.shortDescription: Translates this object along its side Point3D ( local x ) in the parent frame.

method.name: moveUpwards
method.description:
Translates this object along its up Point3D ( local y ) in the parent frame.

If you imagine yourself in the world, it would be a step up or down
in the direction of your body, not always vertically!
method.shortDescription: Translates this object along its up Point3D ( local y ) in the parent frame.

method.name: moveVertically
method.description:
Translates this object vertically in ots parent frame.

If you imagine yourself in the world, it would be a strictly vertical step, ( in the global y direction )
method.shortDescription: Translates this object vertically in ots parent frame.

method.name: resetCoords
method.description: Resets the coordinate system for this object. Useful for returning to known state.
method.shortDescription: Resets the coordinate system for this object.

method.name: rotateAxis
method.description:
Rotate this object around the specified axis in the parent frame by the specified angle.

NOTE : The axis will be normalized automatically.
method.shortDescription: Rotate this object around the specified axis in the parent frame by the specified angle.

param.name: p_nX
param.description: The x coordinate of the axis

param.name: p_nY
param.description: The y coordinate of the axis

param.name: p_nZ
param.description: The z coordinate of the axis

param.name: p_nAngle
param.description: The angle of rotation in degrees.

method.name: setPosition
method.description: Sets the position of this object in coordinates of its parent frame.
method.shortDescription: Sets the position of this object in coordinates of its parent frame.

method.name: toString
method.description: Returns a string representation of this object
method.shortDescription: Returns a string representation of this object
method.result: The fully qualified name of this class

method.name: translate
method.description: Translate this object from it's current position with the specified offsets.
method.shortDescription: Translate this object from it's current position with the specified offsets.

param.name: p_nX
param.description: Offset that will be added to the x coordinate of the object

param.name: p_nY
param.description: Offset that will be added to the y coordinate of the object

param.name: p_nZ
param.description: Offset that will be added to the z coordinate of the object

method.name: update
method.description:
Updates this node or object.

For node's with transformation, this method updates the transformation taking into account the matrix cache system.
FIXME: Transformable nodes shall upate their transform if necessary before calling this method.
method.shortDescription: Updates this node or object.

param.name: p_bChanged
param.description: The matrix which represents the parent model matrix. Basically it stores the rotation/translation/scale of all the nodes above the current one.

method.name: updateTransform
method.description: Updates the transform matrix of the current object/node before it is rendered.
method.shortDescription: Updates the transform matrix of the current object/node before it is rendered.

field.name: disable
field.description: Disable the local transformations applied to this Node if set to false. They will be applied back once et back to true.
field.shortDescription: Disable the local transformations applied to this Node if set to false.

field.name: invModelMatrix
field.description:
Inverse of the model matrix The matrix is inverted in comparison of the real model matrix.
For example, this allows replacement of the objects in the correct camera frame before projection
field.shortDescription:
Inverse of the model matrix The matrix is inverted in comparison of the real model matrix.
For example, this allows replacement of the objects in the correct camera frame before projection

field.name: out
field.description: Forward direction ( local z ) in parent coordinates.
field.shortDescription: Forward direction ( local z ) in parent coordinates.

field.name: scaleX
field.description:
x scale of this object.

A value of 1 scales to the original x scale, a value of 2 doubles the x scale.
NOTE : This value does not affect the camera object.
field.shortDescription: x scale of this object.

field.name: scaleY
field.description:
y scale of this object.

A value of 1 scales to the original y scale, a value of 2 doubles the y scale.
NOTE : This value does not affect the camera object.
field.shortDescription: y scale of this object.

field.name: scaleZ
field.description:
z scale of this object.

A value of 1 scales to the original z scale, a value of 2 doubles the z scale.
NOTE : This value does not affect the camera object.
field.shortDescription: z scale of this object.

field.name: side
field.description: Side direction ( local x ) in parent coordinates.
field.shortDescription: Side direction ( local x ) in parent coordinates.

field.name: tilt
field.description: Getter for the tilt value
field.shortDescription: Getter for the tilt value

field.name: up
field.description: Up direction ( local y ) in parent coordinates.
field.shortDescription: Up direction ( local y ) in parent coordinates.

field.name: x
field.description: x position of this object in its parent frame.
field.shortDescription: x position of this object in its parent frame.

field.name: y
field.description: y position of this object in its parent frame.
field.shortDescription: y position of this object in its parent frame.

field.name: z
field.description: z position of the node in its parent frame.
field.shortDescription: z position of the node in its parent frame.

field.name: pan
field.description:
Pans this object around the local y axis.

The pan angle interval is 0 to 360 degrees
Directions within the parent frame are: North = 0, East = 90, South = 180 nad West = 270 degrees.
field.shortDescription: Pans this object around the local y axis.

customs.param: p_nAngle The pan angle in degrees.

field.name: roll
field.description:
Rolls this object around the local z axis.

The roll angle interval is -180 to +180 degrees
At 0 degrees the local x axis is aligned with the horizon of its parent
Full roll right = 180 and full roll left = -180 degrees ( upside down ).
field.shortDescription: Rolls this object around the local z axis.

customs.param: p_nAngle The roll angle in degrees.

field.name: rotateX
field.description:
Rotates this object around an axis parallel to the parent's x axis.

The object rotates a specified angle ( degrees ) around an axis through the objects reference point, paralell to the x axis of the parent frame.
field.shortDescription: Rotates this object around an axis parallel to the parent's x axis.

field.name: rotateY
field.description:
Rotates this object around an axis parallel to the parent's y axis.

The object rotates a specified angle ( degrees ) around an axis through the objects reference point, parallel to the y axis of the parent frame.
field.shortDescription: Rotates this object around an axis parallel to the parent's y axis.

field.name: rotateZ
field.description:
Rotates this object around an axis paralell to the parent's z axis.

The object rotates a specified angle ( degrees ) around an axis through the objects reference point, paralell to the z axis of the parent frame.
field.shortDescription: Rotates this object around an axis paralell to the parent's z axis.

asClass.name: INodeOperation
asClass.description:
Interface for node operations.

Implements the visitor design pattern: Using the visitor design pattern, you can define a new operation on Node and its subclasses without having to change the classes and without having to take care of traversing the node tree.
asClass.shortDescription: Interface for node operations.
asClass.author: flexrails
asClass.example:
<listing version="3.1">
      var mySpecialOperation:SpecialOperation = new SpecialOperation;
  
      mySpecialOperation.someParameter = 0.8;
      someTreeNode.perform(mySpecialOperation);
      trace(mySpecialOperation.someResult);
  
      mySpecialOperation.someParameter = 0.2;
      someOtherTreeNode.perform(mySpecialOperation);
      trace(mySpecialOperation.someResult);
  </listing>

param.name: p_oNode
param.description: p_oNode The node the exit operation is to be performed on

constructor.name: Sound3D
constructor.description: Creates a 3D sound object wich can be placed in the 3d scene. Set stereo to true if the sound source is in stereo. If stereo is true, both channels are at the same position in 3d space, but the stereo panorama is kept and mirrored if required. To create a true stereo effect, take two Sound3D instances and two mono sound sources on different locations in 3d space.
constructor.shortDescription: Creates a 3D sound object wich can be placed in the 3d scene.

param.name: p_sName
param.description: p_sName A string identifier for this object

param.name: p_oSoundSource
param.description: The sound source, a String, UrlRequest, Sound or a SoundChannel object

param.name: p_nMaxPan
param.description: Max pan of the sound, if zero panning is disabled

param.name: p_nRadius
param.description: Radius of the sound in 3d units

param.name: p_bStereo
param.description: If the sound contains two different channels

method.name: play
method.description: Start Sound sources of type Sound or UrlRequest. Sound sources of type SoundChannel don't support the play method
method.shortDescription: Start Sound sources of type Sound or UrlRequest.

method.name: stop
method.description: Stop the sound source and SoundChannel
method.shortDescription: Stop the sound source and SoundChannel

field.name: flipPan
field.description: If flipPan is true the left and right channels of the sound are mirrored if the camera is facing away from the sound
field.shortDescription: If flipPan is true the left and right channels of the sound are mirrored if the camera is facing away from the sound

field.name: loopStartTime
field.description: Start time to play the audio from if the sound loops
field.shortDescription: Start time to play the audio from if the sound loops

field.name: loops
field.description: Number of loops before the sound stops
field.shortDescription: Number of loops before the sound stops

field.name: maxPan
field.description: Maximal pan is a positive Number from 0-1 or higher
field.shortDescription: Maximal pan is a positive Number from 0-1 or higher

field.name: soundPan
field.description: If pan is true the panning of the sound is relative to the camera rotation
field.shortDescription: If pan is true the panning of the sound is relative to the camera rotation

field.name: soundRadius
field.description: The radius of the sound
field.shortDescription: The radius of the sound

field.name: soundVolume
field.description: Max volume of the sound if camera position is at sound position
field.shortDescription: Max volume of the sound if camera position is at sound position

field.name: startTime
field.description: The start time to play the audio from
field.shortDescription: The start time to play the audio from

field.name: stereo
field.description: If the sound contains two channels, stereo have to be set to true in order to mix left and right channels correctly
field.shortDescription: If the sound contains two channels, stereo have to be set to true in order to mix left and right channels correctly

field.name: type
field.description: Type is either SPEECH or NOISE, SPEECH will start the sound at the last position if the camera enters the sphere of the sound
field.shortDescription: Type is either SPEECH or NOISE, SPEECH will start the sound at the last position if the camera enters the sphere of the sound

field.name: isFlipped
field.description: Returns true if the stereo panorama is mirrored, flipPan have to be true to enable stereo flipping
field.shortDescription: Returns true if the stereo panorama is mirrored, flipPan have to be true to enable stereo flipping

field.name: soundSource
field.description: Returns the sound source, the sound source may be a URLRequest, Sound or SoundChannel object
field.shortDescription: Returns the sound source, the sound source may be a URLRequest, Sound or SoundChannel object

param.name: p_nWidth
param.description: p_nWidth Width of the camera viewport in pixels.

param.name: p_nHeight
param.description: p_nHeight Height of the camera viewport in pixels.

param.name: fov
param.description: fov This value is the vertical Field Of View (FOV) in degrees.

param.name: near
param.description: near Distance to the near clipping plane.

param.name: far
param.description: far Distance to the far clipping plane.

field.name: _camTarget
field.description: [optional] Target object3d that camera should follow. If target is null, camera behaves just like a normal Camera3D.
field.shortDescription: [optional] Target object3d that camera should follow.

field.name: damping
field.description: Damping is the spring internal friction, or how much it resists the "boinggggg" effect. Too high and you'll lose it! A number between 1 and 20 is recommended.
field.shortDescription: Damping is the spring internal friction, or how much it resists the "boinggggg" effect.

field.name: lookOffset
field.description: offset of facing in target object space, ie: where in the target object space should the camera look.
field.shortDescription: offset of facing in target object space, ie: where in the target object space should the camera look.

field.name: mass
field.description: Mass of the camera, if over 120 and it'll be very heavy to move.
field.shortDescription: Mass of the camera, if over 120 and it'll be very heavy to move.

field.name: positionOffset
field.description: Offset of spring center from target in target object space, ie: Where the camera should ideally be in the target object space.
field.shortDescription: Offset of spring center from target in target object space, ie: Where the camera should ideally be in the target object space.

field.name: stiffness
field.description: Stiffness of the spring, how hard is it to extend. The higher it is, the more "fixed" the cam will be. A number between 1 and 20 is recommended.
field.shortDescription: Stiffness of the spring, how hard is it to extend.

asClass.name: Node
asClass.description:
ABSTRACT CLASS - Base class for all nodes in the object tree.

The base class for all Group and object nodes, that handles all basic operations on a tree node.
asClass.shortDescription: ABSTRACT CLASS - Base class for all nodes in the object tree.
asClass.author: Thomas Pfeiffer - kiroukou

constructor.name: Node
constructor.description:
Creates a node in the object tree of the world.

This constructor should normally not be called directly, only from a sub class.
constructor.shortDescription: Creates a node in the object tree of the world.

param.name: p_sName
param.description: A string identifier for this object.

method.name: addChild
method.description:
Adds a new child to this node.

A node can have several children, and when you add a child to a node, it is automatically connected to the parent node through its parent property.
method.shortDescription: Adds a new child to this node.

method.name: addEventListener
method.description: Adds a listener for the specified event.
method.shortDescription: Adds a listener for the specified event.

method.name: cull
method.description:
Tests this node against the frustum volume to get its visibility.

If the node and its children aren't in the frustum, the node is set to cull and will not be displayed.

The method also updates the bounding volumes, to make a more accurate culling system possible.
First the bounding sphere is updated, and if intersecting, the bounding box is updated to perform a more precise culling.

[MANDATORY] The update method must be called first!
method.shortDescription: Tests this node against the frustum volume to get its visibility.

param.name: p_oFrustum
param.description: The current scene which is rendered

param.name: p_oViewMatrix
param.description: The frustum of the current camera.

param.name: p_bChanged
param.description: The matrix which maps object local coordinates into camera coordinates.

method.name: destroy
method.description:
Delete this node and all its child nodes.

This node nad all its child nodes are deleted, including all data they are storing.
The method makes recursive calls to the destroy method of the child nodes.
method.shortDescription: Delete this node and all its child nodes.

method.name: getChildByName
method.description: Returns the child node with the specified name.
method.shortDescription: Returns the child node with the specified name.
method.result: The requested node or null if no child with this name was found

param.name: p_sName
param.description: The name of the child you want to retrieve

param.name: p_bRecurs
param.description: Set to true if you want to search the the children for the requested node

method.name: hasParent
method.description: Tests if this node has a parent.
method.shortDescription: Tests if this node has a parent.
method.result: true if this node has a parent, false otherwise.

method.name: isParent
method.description: Tests if the node passed in the argument is parent of this node.
method.shortDescription: Tests if the node passed in the argument is parent of this node.
method.result: true if the node in the argument is the parent of this node, false otherwise.

method.name: perform
method.example:
<listing version="3.1">
       var mySpecialOperation:SpecialOperation = new SpecialOperation;
   
       mySpecialOperation.someParameter = 0.8;
       someTreeNode.perform(mySpecialOperation);
       trace(mySpecialOperation.someResult);
   
       mySpecialOperation.someParameter = 0.2;
       someOtherTreeNode.perform(mySpecialOperation);
       trace(mySpecialOperation.someResult);
   </listing>
method.description:
Performs an operation on this node and all of its children.

Traverses the subtree made up of this node and all of its children. While traversing the subtree, individual operations are performed on entry and exit of each node of the subtree.

Implements the visitor design pattern: Using the visitor design pattern, you can define a new operation on Node and its subclasses without having to change the classes and without having to take care of traversing the node tree.
method.shortDescription: Performs an operation on this node and all of its children.

param.name: p_iOperation
param.description: p_iOperation The operation to be performed on the node subtree

method.name: remove
method.description:
Removes this node from the node tree, saving its child nodes.

NOTE that remove method only remove the current node and NOT its children!
To remove the current node and all its children please refer to the destroy method.

The child nodes of this node becomes child nodes of this node's parent.
method.shortDescription: Removes this node from the node tree, saving its child nodes.

method.name: removeChildByName
method.description:
Removes the child node with the specified name.

All children of the node you want to remove are lost.
The link between them and the rest of the tree is broken, and they will not be rendered anymore!

The object itself and its children are still in memory!
If you want to free them completely, call child.destroy()
method.shortDescription: Removes the child node with the specified name.
method.result: true if the node was removed from node tree, false otherwise.

param.name: p_sName
param.description: The name of the node you want to remove.

method.name: removeEventListener
method.description: Removes a listener for the specified event.
method.shortDescription: Removes a listener for the specified event.

method.name: swapParent
method.description:
Moves this node to another parent node.

This node is removed from its current parent node, and added as a child of the specified node
method.shortDescription: Moves this node to another parent node.

param.name: p_oNewParent
param.description: The node to become parent of this node

method.name: toString
method.description: Returns a string representation of this object
method.shortDescription: Returns a string representation of this object
method.result: The fully qualified name of this class

method.name: update
method.description:
Updates this node.

For a node with transformation, this method update the transformation taking into account the matrix cache system.
method.shortDescription: Updates this node.

method.name: updateBoundingVolumes
method.description: Updates the bounding volumes of this object. NO IMPLEMENTATION RIGHT NOW. MIGHT BE USED IN THE FUTURE
method.shortDescription: Updates the bounding volumes of this object.

field.name: boundingBox
field.description: The bounding box of this node IMPORTANT: Do not modify it unless you perfectly know what you are doing
field.shortDescription: The bounding box of this node IMPORTANT: Do not modify it unless you perfectly know what you are doing

field.name: boundingSphere
field.description: The bounding sphere of this node IMPORTANT: Do not modify it unless you perfectly know what you are doing
field.shortDescription: The bounding sphere of this node IMPORTANT: Do not modify it unless you perfectly know what you are doing

field.description: The children of this node are stored inside this array. IMPORTANT: Use this property mainly as READ ONLY. To add, delete or search a specific child, you can use the specific method to do that
field.shortDescription: The children of this node are stored inside this array.

field.name: culled
field.description: This property represent the culling state of the current node. This state is defined during the culling phasis as it refers to the position of the object against the viewing frustum.
field.shortDescription: This property represent the culling state of the current node.

field.name: id

The unique id of this node in the node graph.

This value is very useful to retrieve a specific node.

field.shortDescription: Cached matrix corresponding to the transformation to the 0,0,0 frame system

field.shortDescription: Cached matrix corresponding to the transformation to the camera frame system

The broadcaster

The broadcaster

This property is a BubbleEventBroadcaster.

field.description: Change the interactivity of all the children
field.shortDescription: Change the interactivity of all the children

field.description: Make all the Shape3D and descendants children react to this value.

asClass.name: IDisplayable
asClass.description:
The IDisplayable interface should be implemented by all visible objects.
<This ensures that all necessary methods are implemented>
asClass.shortDescription: The IDisplayable interface should be implemented by all visible objects.
asClass.author: Thomas Pfeiffer - kiroukou

asClass.name: Sprite2D
asClass.description:
The Sprite2D class is used to create a 2D sprite.

A Sprite2D object is used to display a static or dynamic texture in the Sandy world.
The sprite always shows the same side to the camera. This is useful when you want to show more or less complex images, without heavy calculations of perspective distortion.

The Sprite2D has a fixed bounding sphere radius, set by default to 30.
In case your sprite is bigger, you can adjust it to avoid any frustum culling issue
asClass.shortDescription: The Sprite2D class is used to create a 2D sprite.
asClass.author: Thomas Pfeiffer - kiroukou

method.description:
Clears the graphics object of this object's container.

The the graphics that were drawn on the Graphics object is erased, and the fill and line style settings are reset.

method.name: cull
method.description:
Tests this node against the camera frustum to get its visibility.

If this node and its children are not within the frustum, the node is set to cull and it would not be displayed.

The method also updates the bounding volumes to make the more accurate culling system possible.
First the bounding sphere is updated, and if intersecting, the bounding box is updated to perform the more precise culling.

[MANDATORY] The update method must be called first!

The method makes recursive calls to the destroy method of the child nodes.

method.description:

display the object onto the scene. If the object has autocenter enabled, sprite center is set at screen position. Otherwise the sprite top left corner will be at that position.

field.name: autoCenter
field.description: When enabled, the sprite will be displayed at its graphical center. Otherwise the sprite positioning is controlled by floorCenter property.
field.shortDescription: When enabled, the sprite will be displayed at its graphical center.

field.name: enableForcedDepth
field.description:
Should forced depth be enable for this object?.

If true it is possible to force this object to be drawn at a specific depth,
if false the normal Z-sorting algorithm is applied.

When correctly used, this feature allows you to avoid some Z-sorting problems.
field.shortDescription: Should forced depth be enable for this object?.

field.name: fixedAngle
field.description: Set this to true if you want this sprite to rotate with camera.
field.shortDescription: Set this to true if you want this sprite to rotate with camera.

field.name: floorCenter
field.description: When enabled, the sprite will be displayed at its bottom line. Otherwise it is positioned at its registration point (usually top left corner). This property has no effect when autoCenter is enabled.
field.shortDescription: When enabled, the sprite will be displayed at its bottom line.

field.name: forcedDepth
field.description:
The forced depth for this object.

To make this feature work, you must enable the ForcedDepth system too.
The higher the depth is, the sooner the more far the object will be represented.
field.shortDescription: The forced depth for this object.

field.description: The container of this sprite ( canvas )
field.shortDescription: The container of this sprite ( canvas )

field.name: content
field.description: Gives access to your content reference. The content is the exact visual object you passed to the constructor. In comparison with the container which is the container of the content (in Sandy's architecture, the container must be a Sprite), but the content can be any kind of visual object AS3 offers (MovieClip, Bitmap, Sprite etc.) WARNNIG: Be careful when manipulating the content object to not break any link with the sandy container (content.parent).
field.shortDescription: Gives access to your content reference.

field.name: depth
field.description:
The depth to draw this sprite at.

The scale of this sprite.

Using scale, you can change the dimension of the sprite rapidly.

asClass.name: Geometry3D
asClass.description:
The Geometry3D class holds a complete description of the geometry of a Shape3D. It contains points, faces, normals and uv coordinates. NOTE: For best performance, Geometry should be created in offline mode, especially all faces, as createFace() validates all points if these points exist in points array. NOTE: This object is going to work well _ONLY_ if arrays wont be changed directlly [ie. push()] but _ONLY_ via accessor methods: createFace, createFaceByIds, addFace, addFaces. In the future we can make these Arrays PRIVATE but then the only way to make them safe is to deliver additionall accessors like getPoint(index:int), getFace(index:int) what could potentially slow affect performance of this structure (well, we need to test it, and if there is no problem, make arrays private and provide accessors for _SINGLE_ array's elements to make them safe ).

[ToDo: Revise this and adopt tp ASDoc]
asClass.shortDescription: The Geometry3D class holds a complete description of the geometry of a Shape3D.
asClass.author:
<author><![CDATA[Mirek Mencel
  ]]></author>
<author><![CDATA[Thomas PFEIFFER
  ]]></author>

Returns a clone of this Geometry3D.

NOTE: Because polygons also stores instance-specific data like Appearance on the Geometry level, we are considering it only as a set of connections between points, so only coordinates and normals are copied in the clone process.
method.shortDescription: Returns a clone of this Geometry3D.

asClass.name: TransformGroup
asClass.description:
The TransformGroup class is used to create transform group.

It represents a node in the object tree of the world.
Transformations performed on this group are applied to all its children.

The class is final, i.e. it can not be subclassed.
asClass.shortDescription: The TransformGroup class is used to create transform group.
asClass.author: Thomas Pfeiffer - kiroukou

field.name: disable

Inverse of the model matrix The matrix is inverted in comparison of the real model matrix.
For example, this allows replacement of the objects in the correct camera frame before projection

method.name: cull
method.description:
Tests this node against the camera frustum to get its visibility.

If this node and its children are not within the frustum, the node is set to cull and it would not be displayed.

The method also updates the bounding volumes to make the more accurate culling system possible.
First the bounding sphere is updated, and if intersecting, the bounding box is updated to perform the more precise culling.

[MANDATORY] The update method must be called first!
method.shortDescription: Tests this node against the camera frustum to get its visibility.

param.name: p_oViewMatrix
param.description: The frustum of the current camera

param.name: p_bChanged
param.description: The view martix of the curren camera

method.description: Returns a string representation of the TransformGroup.
method.shortDescription: Returns a string representation of the TransformGroup.

asClass.name: Shape3D
asClass.description:
The Shape3D class is the base class of all true 3D shapes.

It represents a node in the object tree of the world.
A Shape3D is a leaf node and can not have any child nodes.

It must be the child of a branch group or a transform group, but transformations can be applied to the Shape directly.
asClass.shortDescription: The Shape3D class is the base class of all true 3D shapes.
asClass.author: Thomas Pfeiffer - kiroukou

constructor.name: Shape3D
constructor.description:
Creates a 3D object

This creates a new 3D geometry object. That object will handle the rendering of a static Geometry3D object into a real 3D object and finally to the 2D camera representation.
constructor.shortDescription:
Creates a 3D object

This creates a new 3D geometry object.

param.name: p_sName
param.description: A string identifier for this object

param.name: p_oAppearance
param.description: The appearance of this object. If no apperance is given, the DEFAULT_APPEARANCE will be applied.

param.name: p_bUseSingleContainer
param.description: Whether tis object should use a single container to draw on

method.name: clear
method.description:
Clears the graphics object of this object's container.

The the graphics that were drawn on the Graphics object is erased, and the fill and line style settings are reset.
method.shortDescription: Clears the graphics object of this object's container.

method.name: clone
method.description: This method returns a clone of this Shape3D. The current appearance will be applied, and the geometry is cloned (not referenced to curent one).
method.shortDescription: This method returns a clone of this Shape3D.

param.name: p_sName
param.description: The name of the new shape you are going to create

param.name: p_bKeepTransform
param.description: Boolean value which, if set to true, applies the current local transformations to the cloned shape. Default value is false.

method.name: cull
method.description:
Tests this node against the camera frustum to get its visibility.

If this node and its children are not within the frustum, the node is set to cull and it would not be displayed.

The method also updates the bounding volumes to make the more accurate culling system possible.
First the bounding sphere is updated, and if intersecting, the bounding box is updated to perform the more precise culling.

[MANDATORY] The update method must be called first!
method.shortDescription: Tests this node against the camera frustum to get its visibility.

param.name: p_oViewMatrix
param.description: The frustum of the current camera

param.name: p_bChanged
param.description: The view martix of the curren camera

method.name: destroy
method.description: Destroy this object and all its faces container object is removed, and graphics cleared. All polygons have their
method.shortDescription: Destroy this object and all its faces container object is removed, and graphics cleared.

method.name: display
method.description:
Performs a z-sorting and renders the objects visible polygons.

The method is called only if the object renders on a single container
- ( useSingleContainer = true ).
method.shortDescription: Performs a z-sorting and renders the objects visible polygons.

method.name: setConvexFlag
method.description: Sets SORT_NONE or SORT_AVGZ sorting mode. Deprecated.
method.shortDescription: Sets SORT_NONE or SORT_AVGZ sorting mode.

customs.internal: this is now here for backward compatibility only.

method.name: swapCulling
method.description:
Changes the backface culling side.

When you want to display a cube and you are the cube, you see its external faces.
The internal faces are not drawn due to back face culling

In case you are inside the cube, by default Sandy's engine still doesn't draw the internal faces (because you should not be in there).

If you need to be only inside the cube, you can call this method to change which side is culled.
The faces will be visible only from the interior of the cube.

If you want to be both on the inside and the outside, you want to make the faces visible from on both sides.
In that case you just have to set enableBackFaceCulling to false.
method.shortDescription: Changes the backface culling side.

method.name: toString
method.description: Returns a string representation of this object.
method.shortDescription: Returns a string representation of this object.
method.result: The fully qualified name of this object and its geometry.

method.name: updateBoundingVolumes
method.description: Updates the bounding volumes of this object.
method.shortDescription: Updates the bounding volumes of this object.

field.name: SORT_AVGZ
field.description: Average distance sorting. Default sorting mode. Carefully designed models will display just fine, but ordering problems are common. This is also the only possible sorting mode with useSingleContainer set to false.
field.shortDescription: Average distance sorting.

field.name: SORT_CUSTOM_BSP
field.description: In this mode mesh is sorted using BSP tree, but no tree is built for you (you need to set bsp property yourself). Experimental.
field.shortDescription: In this mode mesh is sorted using BSP tree, but no tree is built for you (you need to set bsp property yourself).

field.name: SORT_LAZY_BSP
field.description: In this mode mesh is sorted using BSP tree, but no faces are split for you (means sorting problems are still possible). Experimental.
field.shortDescription: In this mode mesh is sorted using BSP tree, but no faces are split for you (means sorting problems are still possible).

field.name: SORT_NONE
field.description: No sorting. Only convex shapes are guaranteed to display correctly in this mode.
field.shortDescription: No sorting.

field.name: aPolygons
field.description: The array of polygons building this object.
field.shortDescription: The array of polygons building this object.

field.name: aVisiblePolygons
field.description: Array containing the visible polygons of that shape. Contente is available after the SCENE_RENDER_DISPLAYLIST event of the current scene has been dispatched
field.shortDescription: Array containing the visible polygons of that shape.

field.name: animated
field.description:
Animated flag.

If the geometry vertices are dynamically modified by some animation engine or mathematic function, some polygon may disapear with no reason. The normal Point3D is used to compute the polygon visibility, and if you don't update the normal Point3D after the vertices modifications, there's an error. To fix that problem, Sandy3D offers that new property appeared in 3.0.3 release, which once set to true, automatically update the normal Point3Ds for you. As a performance warning, don't set this value to true if your model geometry isn't animated.
field.shortDescription: Animated flag.

field.name: bsp
field.description: Root node of BSP tree.
field.shortDescription: Root node of BSP tree.

field.name: enableForcedDepth
field.description:
Should forced depth be enable for this object?.

If true it is possible to force this object to be drawn at a specific depth,
if false the normal Z-sorting algorithm is applied.

When correctly used, this feature allows you to avoid some Z-sorting problems.
field.shortDescription: Should forced depth be enable for this object?.

field.name: enableNearClipping
field.description:
Enable the Frustum near plane clipping on the visible polygons. Enable this when you need a perfect intersection between the front camera plane. This is mainly used when you need the camera to move on a long plane.

Important: Enable the clipping makes process a bit slower, especially with big scenes.
field.shortDescription: Enable the Frustum near plane clipping on the visible polygons.

field.name: forcedDepth
field.description:
The forced depth for this object.

To make this feature work, you must enable the ForcedDepth system too.
The higher the depth is, the sooner the more far the object will be represented.
field.shortDescription: The forced depth for this object.

field.name: container
field.description: The contianer for this object. This container property exist if the useSingleContainer is set to true. It is a direct access to the Shape3D container to, for example, apply nice effects such as filters etc.
field.shortDescription: The contianer for this object.

field.name: depth
field.description: The depth of this object. In case the useSingleContainer mode is enabled (default mode), this value returns the means depth of the Shape in the camera frame. This value is mainly used as a z-sorting value.
field.shortDescription: The depth of this object.

field.name: geometryCenter
field.description: This property call allows you to get the geometryCenter offset Point3D of the Shape. Modifying this Point3D will impact the way the shape is rendered, mainly its rotation center.
field.shortDescription: This property call allows you to get the geometryCenter offset Point3D of the Shape.

field.name: material
field.description: Returns the material currently used by the renderer
field.shortDescription: Returns the material currently used by the renderer

field.name: sortingMode
field.description: Faces sorting method. With useSingleContainer set to false only SORT_AVGZ is possible.
field.shortDescription: Faces sorting method.

field.name: appearance
field.description: Set the appearance of this object. NOTE: Please mind that Sandy3D allows to set an appearance at a polygon level.
field.shortDescription: Set the appearance of this object.

customs.param: p_oApp The appearance object which stores the front material and -if set- the back material which represents that shape.

field.name: enableBackFaceCulling
field.description:
Should back face culling be enabled for this object?.

If set to false all faces of this object are drawn.
A true value enables the back face culling algorithm - Default true
field.shortDescription: Should back face culling be enabled for this object?.

field.name: enableEvents
field.shortDescription: Enables the event system for mouse events.

field.name: geometry
field.description: The geometry of this object.
field.shortDescription: The geometry of this object.

field.name: scene
field.description: Reference to the scene is it linked to. Initialized at null.
field.shortDescription: Reference to the scene is it linked to.

field.name: useSingleContainer
field.description:
setter that allow user to change the way to render this object. set to true, the shape will be rendered into a single Sprite object, which is accessible through the container property. set to false, the container property does not target anything, but all the polygons will be rendered into their own dedidated container.

If true, this object renders itself on a single container ( Sprite ),
if false, each polygon is rendered on its own container.
field.shortDescription: setter that allow user to change the way to render this object.

asClass.name: Group
asClass.description:
The Group class is used for branch nodes in the Sandy object tree.

This class is fianl, and can not be sub classed

This group binds together, but can not transform its children.
To transform collections of objects, you should add them to a transform group.
asClass.shortDescription: The Group class is used for branch nodes in the Sandy object tree.
asClass.author: Thomas Pfeiffer - kiroukou

method.name: destroy
method.description:
Delete this node and all its child nodes.

This node nad all its child nodes are deleted, including all data they are storing.
The method makes recursive calls to the destroy method of the child nodes.
method.shortDescription: Delete this node and all its child nodes.

method.name: display
method.description: Displays the starfield.
method.shortDescription: Displays the starfield.

method.name: remove
method.description: Provide the classical remove behaviour, plus remove the container to the display list.
method.shortDescription: Provide the classical remove behaviour, plus remove the container to the display list.

method.name: render
method.description: Renders the starfield
method.shortDescription: Renders the starfield

field.name: depthIndex
field.description: An index in stars array; if set to valid value, depth returns distance to that star.
field.shortDescription: An index in stars array; if set to valid value, depth returns distance to that star.

field.name: fadeFrom
field.description: Distance from screen where stars start to fade out
field.shortDescription: Distance from screen where stars start to fade out

field.name: fadeTo
field.description: Distance from fadeFrom to the point where stars fade out completely
field.shortDescription: Distance from fadeFrom to the point where stars fade out completely

field.name: starColors
field.description: Array of star colors (if not specified, white is used).
field.shortDescription: Array of star colors (if not specified, white is used).

field.name: starSprites
field.description:
Array of star sprites (any IBitmapDrawable-s; if not specified, StarField uses setPixel to draw a star).

Star sprites are affected by corresponding starColors value; for DisplayObject-s, StarField will use their blendMode to draw them.
field.shortDescription: Array of star sprites (any IBitmapDrawable-s; if not specified, StarField uses setPixel to draw a star).

field.name: stars
field.description: Array of Vertex - star coordinates data.
field.shortDescription: Array of Vertex - star coordinates data.

field.name: container
field.description: The container of this object
field.shortDescription: The container of this object

field.name: depth
field.description: The depth to draw the starfield at. If depthIndex is set to valid value, depth returns distance to that star, otherwise value set by user (default: 1e10).
field.shortDescription: The depth to draw the starfield at.

asClass.name: Camera3D
asClass.description:
The Camera3D class is used to create a camera for the Sandy world.

As of this version of Sandy, the camera is added to the object tree, which means it is transformed in the same manner as any other object.
asClass.shortDescription: The Camera3D class is used to create a camera for the Sandy world.
asClass.author: Thomas Pfeiffer - kiroukou

constructor.name: Camera3D
constructor.description:
Creates a camera for projecting visible objects in the world.

By default the camera shows a perspective projection.
The camera is at -300 in z axis and look at the world 0,0,0 point.
constructor.shortDescription: Creates a camera for projecting visible objects in the world.

param.name: p_nWidth
param.description: Width of the camera viewport in pixels

param.name: p_nHeight
param.description: Height of the camera viewport in pixels

param.name: p_nFov
param.description: The vertical angle of view in degrees - Default 45

param.name: p_nNear
param.description: The distance from the camera to the near clipping plane - Default 50

param.name: p_nFar
param.description: The distance from the camera to the far clipping plane - Default 10000

method.name: cull
method.description: Nothing to do - the camera can't be culled
method.shortDescription: Nothing to do - the camera can't be culled

method.name: destroy
method.description: Delete the camera node and clear its displaylist.
method.shortDescription: Delete the camera node and clear its displaylist.

method.name: projectArray
method.description: Project the vertices list given in parameter. The vertices are projected to the screen, as a 2D position. A cache system is used here to prevent multiple projection of the same vertex. In case you want to redo a projection, prefer projectVertex method which doesn't use a cache system.
method.shortDescription: Project the vertices list given in parameter.

method.name: projectVertex
method.description: Project the vertex passed as parameter. The vertices are projected to the screen, as a 2D position.
method.shortDescription: Project the vertex passed as parameter.

method.name: setPerspectiveProjection
method.description:
Sets a projection matrix with perspective.

This projection allows a natural visual presentation of objects, mimicking 3D perspective.
method.shortDescription: Sets a projection matrix with perspective.

param.name: p_nFovY
param.description: The angle of view in degrees - Default 45.

param.name: p_nAspectRatio
param.description: The ratio between vertical and horizontal dimension - Default the viewport ratio (width/height)

param.name: p_nZNear
param.description: The distance betweeen the camera and the near plane - Default 10.

param.name: p_nZFar
param.description: The distance betweeen the camera position and the far plane. Default 10 000.

method.name: update
method.description: Updates the state of the camera transformation.
method.shortDescription: Updates the state of the camera transformation.

param.name: p_bChanged
param.description: The matrix which represents the parent model matrix. Basically it stores the rotation/translation/scale of all the nodes above the current one.

method.name: updatePerspective
method.description: Updates the perspective projection.
method.shortDescription: Updates the perspective projection.

field.name: frustrum
field.description: The frustum of the camera.
field.shortDescription: The frustum of the camera.

field.name: viewport
field.description: The camera viewport
field.shortDescription: The camera viewport

field.name: invProjectionMatrix
field.description: Returns the inverse of the projection matrix of this camera.
field.shortDescription: Returns the inverse of the projection matrix of this camera.

field.name: projectionMatrix
field.description: Returns the projection matrix of this camera.
field.shortDescription: Returns the projection matrix of this camera.

field.name: far
field.description: Far plane distance for culling/clipping.
field.shortDescription: Far plane distance for culling/clipping.

field.name: focalLength
field.description:
Focal length of camera.

This value is a function of fov angle and viewport dimensions. Writing this value changes fov angle only.
field.shortDescription: Focal length of camera.

field.name: fov
field.description: The angle of view of this camera in degrees.
field.shortDescription: The angle of view of this camera in degrees.

field.name: near
field.description: Near plane distance for culling/clipping.
field.shortDescription: Near plane distance for culling/clipping.

asClass.name: Sprite3D
asClass.description:
The Sprite3D class is used to create a 3D sprite.

A Sprite3D can be seen as a special Sprite2D.
It has an appearance that is a movie clip containing 360 frames (as maximum!) with texture.

Depending on the camera position, a different frame of the clip is shown, givin a 3D effect.
asClass.shortDescription: The Sprite3D class is used to create a 3D sprite.
asClass.author: Thomas Pfeiffer - kiroukou

field.name: autoCenter
field.shortDescription: When enabled, the sprite will be displayed at its graphical center.

field.name: enableForcedDepth
field.shortDescription: Should forced depth be enable for this object?.

field.name: fixedAngle
field.shortDescription: Set this to true if you want this sprite to rotate with camera.

field.name: floorCenter
field.shortDescription: When enabled, the sprite will be displayed at its bottom line.

field.shortDescription: The forced depth for this object.

field.shortDescription: The container of this sprite ( canvas )

field.shortDescription: The depth to draw this sprite at.

field.name: material
field.shortDescription: Material that the sprite will be dressed in.

field.name: scale
field.shortDescription: The scale of this sprite.

asClass.name: MediumAttributes
asClass.description: This attribute provides very basic simulation of partially opaque medium. You can use this attribute to achieve wide range of effects (e.g., fog, Rayleigh scattering, light attached to camera, etc).
asClass.shortDescription: This attribute provides very basic simulation of partially opaque medium.
asClass.author: makc

field.name: flags
field.shortDescription: Returns the specific flags of this attribute.

method.name: begin
method.shortDescription: Method called before the display list rendering.

method.name: draw
method.shortDescription: Draws attribute to the graphics object.

method.name: drawOnSprite
method.shortDescription: Applies attribute to a sprite.

method.name: finish
method.shortDescription: Method called right after the display list rendering.

method.name: init
method.shortDescription: Allows to proceed to an initialization to know when the polyon isn't lined to the material.

method.name: unlink
method.shortDescription: Remove all the initialization (opposite of init).

param.name: p_oFadeFrom
param.description: Attenuation Point3D (500 pixels beyond the screen by default).

param.name: p_oFadeTo
param.description: Transparent point (at the screen by default).

ABSTRACT CLASS - super class for all light attributes.

field.description:
Ambient reflection factor.

Note that since geometry of sprites is unknown, this is going to be the only lighting setting affecting them, so you would typically need to set it to bigger value than you would for shapes.

field.description: Diffuse reflection factor.

field.shortDescription: Specular reflection factor.

asClass.name: PhongAttributes
asClass.description:
Realize a Phong shading on a material.

In true Phong shading, normals are supposed to be interpolated across the surface; here scaled normal projections are interpolated in the light map space. The downside of this method is that in case of low poly models interpolation results are inaccurate - in this case you can improve the result using GouraudAttributes for ambient and diffuse, and then this attribute for specular reflection.
asClass.shortDescription: Realize a Phong shading on a material.
asClass.author: Makc

field.name: ambient
field.shortDescription: Ambient reflection factor.

field.name: diffuse
field.shortDescription: Diffuse reflection factor.

field.name: flags
field.shortDescription: Flags for the attribute.

field.name: gloss
field.shortDescription: Specular exponent.

field.name: specular
field.shortDescription: Specular reflection factor.

method.name: draw
method.shortDescription: Draws light on shape.

method.name: drawOnSprite
method.shortDescription: Draws light on sprite.

param.name: p_nAmbient
param.description: The ambient light value. A value between 0 and 1 is expected.

param.name: p_nQuality
param.description: Quality of light response approximation. A value between 2 and 15 is expected.

param.name: p_nSamples
param.description: A number of calculated samples per anchor. Positive value is expected.

method.name: computeLightMap
method.description:
Compute the light map.

Normally you should not need to call this function, as it is done for you automatically when it is needed. You might call it to compute light map in advance, though.
method.shortDescription: Compute the light map.

param.name: p_oLight
param.description: Light3D object to make the light map for.

param.name: p_nQuality
param.description: Quality of light response approximation. A value between 2 and 15 is expected (Flash radial gradient is used internally light map, thus we can only roughly approximate exact lighting).

param.name: p_nSamples
param.description: A number of calculated samples per anchor. Positive value is expected (greater values will produce a little bit more accurate interpolation with non-equally spaced anchors).

field.name: onlySpecular
field.description:
Flag for rendering mode.

If true, only specular highlight is rendered, when useBright is also true.
If false (the default) ambient and diffuse reflections will also be rendered.
field.shortDescription: Flag for rendering mode.

field.name: spherize
field.description: Non-zero value adds sphere normals to actual normals for light rendering. Use this with flat surfaces or cylinders.
field.shortDescription: Non-zero value adds sphere normals to actual normals for light rendering.

field.name: useBright
field.description:
Flag for lightening mode.

If true (the default), the lit objects use full light range from black to white.
If false they just range from black to their normal appearance; additionally, current implementation does not render specular reflection in this case.
field.shortDescription: Flag for lightening mode.

asClass.shortDescription: A lightmap used for some of the shaders.

field.shortDescription: An array of an array which contains the colors of the strata.

field.name: ratios
field.description: An array of an array which contains the ratios (length) of each strata.
field.shortDescription: An array of an array which contains the ratios (length) of each strata.

Returns a scaled version of a bitmap.

The method takes a bitmap as input, and returns a scaled copy.
The original is not changed.

method.name: movieToBitmap
method.description:
Converts a sprite to a bitmap respecting the sprite position.

The simple BitmapData.draw method doesn't take care of the negative part of the sprite during the draw.
This method does.

param.name: p_oSprite

asClass.name: LoaderQueue
asClass.description:
Utility class for loading resources.

A LoaderQueue allows you to queue up requests for loading external resources.
asClass.shortDescription: Utility class for loading resources.
asClass.author: Thomas Pfeiffer - kiroukou /Max Pellizzaro

event.name: queueLoaderError
event.description: Dispatched when an error is encountered while loading a resource.
event.shortDescription: Dispatched when an error is encountered while loading a resource.
event.eventDescription: Defines the value of the type property of a queueLoaderError event object.

event.name: queueResourceLoaded
event.description: Dispatched when a resource has been loaded.
event.shortDescription: Dispatched when a resource has been loaded.
event.eventDescription: Defines the value of the type property of a queueResourceLoaded event object.

event.name: queueComplete
event.description: Dispatched when all resources have been loaded.
event.shortDescription: Dispatched when all resources have been loaded.
event.eventDescription: Defines the value of the type property of a queueComplete event object.

method.name: add
method.description:
Adds a new request to this loader queue.

The request is given its own loader and is added to a loader queue
The loading is postponed until the start method of the queue is called.
method.shortDescription: Adds a new request to this loader queue.

param.name: p_sID
param.description: A string identifier for this request

method.name: start
method.description:
Starts the loading of all resources in the queue.

All loaders in the queue are started and IOErrorEvent and the COMPLETE event are subscribed too.
method.shortDescription: Starts the loading of all resources in the queue.

field.description: Specifies the Binary type of object to load
field.shortDescription: Specifies the Binary type of object to load

field.shortDescription: Specifies the Image type of object to load

field.name: SWF
field.description: Specifies the SWF type of object to load
field.shortDescription: Specifies the SWF type of object to load

field.name: data
field.description: A list of all resources indexed by their names.
field.shortDescription: A list of all resources indexed by their names.

asClass.name: StringUtil
asClass.description: Utility class for string manipulation.
asClass.shortDescription: Utility class for string manipulation.
asClass.author: Thomas Pfeiffer - kiroukou

method.name: clear
method.description: Strips "\r" and "\n" characters from a string and removes consecutive spaces.
method.shortDescription: Strips "\r" and "\n" characters from a string and removes consecutive spaces.

param.name: p_aExpand
param.description: Other strings you want to clear out.

method.name: clearRepeat
method.description:
Clears the source string from multiple occurences of a pattern.

Ex: If you want to clear "ababab", you can use "ab" as a pattern.
method.shortDescription: Clears the source string from multiple occurences of a pattern.

param.name: p_sRepeat
param.description: Replace chars, default is a space.

method.name: findBlockIndex
method.description:
Returns pairs of start and end indices of a block in a source string.

The target string is searched for blocks of text between a start and and an end delimiter string.
The start and end indices into the searched string, for each found block is stored in a two dimensional array.
All inices are returned as an array of index pairs.

array struct:

array[0] = [Block_Start_String_Length, Block_End_String_Length]

array[1] = [Start_Index_1, End_Index_1]

array[x] = [Start_Index_x, End_Index_x]
method.shortDescription: Returns pairs of start and end indices of a block in a source string.
method.result: An array containtng all the start and end indices.

method.name: getBlockByIndex
method.description: Returns a specific sub string of the source string.
method.shortDescription: Returns a specific sub string of the source string.
method.result: The searched sub string or an empty string if not found.

param.name: p_nIndex
param.description: Start index into the string of the block to search for.

param.name: p_bNoSymbol
param.description: Do not include start and end symbols.

method.name: getBlockRange
method.description: Returns the start and end indices for a substring, analyzed by findBlockIndex.
method.shortDescription: Returns the start and end indices for a substring, analyzed by findBlockIndex.
method.result: The pair of start and end indices, [-1, -1] if not found.

param.name: p_nIndex
param.description: Start index into the string of the block of interest.

method.name: getBlocks
method.description:
Returns all blocks between start and end indices from a source string.

Given an array of index pairs, normally created by a call to findBlockIndex, all blocks between index pairs are extracted and stored in an array
method.shortDescription: Returns all blocks between start and end indices from a source string.
method.result: All blocks between the start and end indices.

param.name: p_bWithSymbol
param.description: Include start and end symbols if set to true.

method.name: getTextBetween
method.description:
Returns all sub strings in a string between two given delimiter patterns.

The delimiters are not included in the results.
method.shortDescription: Returns all sub strings in a string between two given delimiter patterns.
method.result: An array of found sub strings. Empty if no matching patterns were found.

method.name: indexTimes
method.description: Returns the index of the Nth occurance of sub string.
method.shortDescription: Returns the index of the Nth occurance of sub string.
method.result: Start index of the search sub string.

param.name: p_nOccur
param.description: The occurance of the sub string to find.

method.name: replace
method.description: Replaces a sub string with another in the target string.
method.shortDescription: Replaces a sub string with another in the target string.

asClass.name: BezierUtil
asClass.description:
Utility class for Bzier calculations.

All credits go to Alex Ulhmann and his Animation Package Library.
asClass.shortDescription: Utility class for Bzier calculations.
asClass.author: Thomas Pfeiffer - kiroukou

method.name: casteljau
method.description:
Applies the de Casteljau's algorithm.

[ToDo: Better explanations ]
method.shortDescription: Applies the de Casteljau's algorithm.
method.result: The position on the Bzier curve at the fraction p of the curve.

param.name: p
param.description: A fraction between [0-1] of the whole curve.

param.name: plist
param.description: The list of control points of the Bzier curve.

method.name: casteljau_interval
method.description:
Applies a more robust de Casteljau's algorithm if the intervals are "weird".

UNTESTED METHOD. MAY BE REMOVED IN THE FUTURE VERSION. USE IT CAREFULLY.

[ToDo: Better explanations ]
method.shortDescription: Applies a more robust de Casteljau's algorithm if the intervals are "weird".
method.result: The position on the Bzier curve at the fraction p of the curve.

param.name: p
param.description: A fraction between [0-1] of the whole curve.

param.name: plist
param.description: The list of control points of the Bzier curve.

method.name: getCubicControlPoints
method.description:
Returns the control points for a qubic Bzier curve.

If anybody finds a generic method to compute control points for bezier curves with n control points, if only the points on the curve are given, please let us know!
method.shortDescription: Returns the control points for a qubic Bzier curve.
method.result: A two dimensional array containing the two controls points.

param.name: start
param.description: The start point of the curve.

method.name: getPointsOnCubicCurve
method.description:
Returns a point on a qubic Bzier curve.

Adapted from Paul Bourke.
method.shortDescription: Returns a point on a qubic Bzier curve.

param.name: p
param.description: A fraction between [0-1] of the whole curve.

method.name: getPointsOnQuadCurve
method.description:
Returns a point on a quadratic Bzier curve.

Adapted from Robert Penner with Robert Penner's optimization of the standard equation.
method.shortDescription: Returns a point on a quadratic Bzier curve.

param.name: p
param.description: A fraction between [0-1] of the whole curve.

method.name: getQuadControlPoints
method.description:
Returns the control point for a quadratic Bzier curve.

Adapted from Robert Penner's drawCurve3Pts() method.
method.shortDescription: Returns the control point for a quadratic Bzier curve.

param.name: start
param.description: The start point of the curve.

asClass.name: VertexWelder
asClass.description:
The VertexWelder class is a static class that is able to weld duplicate vertices in a geometry.

It can faithfully transfer all UV data in a non-destructive manner, and automatically smooth all vertex normal data by averaging all the normals of duplicate vertices in the geometry.
asClass.shortDescription: The VertexWelder class is a static class that is able to weld duplicate vertices in a geometry.
asClass.author: Gregorius Soedharmo

method.name: weld
method.example: <listing version="3.0"> VertexWelder( myShape3D.geometry, 4); // This will weld myShape3D geometry with 0.0001 welding threshold. </listing>
method.description: Create a clone of a geometry, deletes all redundant data, and welds all duplicate vertex found in the former geometry.
method.shortDescription: Create a clone of a geometry, deletes all redundant data, and welds all duplicate vertex found in the former geometry.

param.name: p_oGeom
param.description: The geometry input to be processed

param.name: p_iPrecision
param.description: The precision threshold of vertex welding.

field.name: geometry
field.description: Cached result of the previous call to weld.
field.shortDescription: Cached result of the previous call to weld.

method.name: applyAlpha
method.description: Returns the color with altered alpha value.

method.name: calculateLitColour
method.description:
Calculate the color for a particular lighting strength.

This converts the supplied pre-multiplied RGB color into HSL then modifies the L according to the light strength. The result is then mapped back into the RGB space.
method.shortDescription: Calculate the color for a particular lighting strength.

method.name: hex2rgb
method.description: Converts a hexadecimal color value to RGB components
method.shortDescription: Converts a hexadecimal color value to RGB components
method.result: The RGB color of the hexadecimal.

method.name: hex2rgbn
method.description: Converts hexadecimal color value to normalized rgb components ( 0 - 1 ).
method.shortDescription: Converts hexadecimal color value to normalized rgb components ( 0 - 1 ).

method.name: rgb2hex
method.description: Converts color component values ( RGB ) to one hexadecimal value.
method.shortDescription: Converts color component values ( RGB ) to one hexadecimal value.
method.result: The hexadecimal value of the RGB color.

method.name: pow
method.description:
Computes the power of a 3D Point3D.

Here the meaning of the power of a Point3D is a new Point3D where each element is the the n:th power of the corresponding element.

Ex: A^n = ( A.x^n, A.y^n, A.z^n )
method.shortDescription: Computes the power of a 3D Point3D.

asClass.name: IntersectionMath
asClass.description: An util class with static method which provides useful functions related to intersection.
asClass.shortDescription: An util class with static method which provides useful functions related to intersection.
asClass.author: Thomas Pfeiffer - kiroukou

method.name: intersectionBSphere
method.description: Determines whether two bounding spheres intersect.
method.shortDescription: Determines whether two bounding spheres intersect.

method.name: intersectionLine2D
method.description: Finds the intersection point of two 2D lines.
method.shortDescription: Finds the intersection point of two 2D lines.
method.result: The point where the two lines intersect. Returns null if lines are coincident or parallel.

param.name: p_oPointA
param.description: A point of the first line.

param.name: p_oPointB
param.description: Another point of the first line.

param.name: p_oPointC
param.description: A point of the second line.

param.name: p_oPointD
param.description: Another point of the second line.

method.name: intersectionLine3D
method.description:
Computes the smallest distance between two 3D lines.

As 3D lines cannot intersect, we compute two points, first owning to the first 3D line, and the second point owning to the second 3D line.

The two points define a segment which length represents the shortest distance between these two lines.
method.shortDescription: Computes the smallest distance between two 3D lines.
method.result: An array containing the Point3Ds of the segment connecting the two 3D lines.

param.name: p_oPointA
param.description: A Point3D of the first 3D line.

param.name: p_oPointB
param.description: Another Point3D of the first 3D line.

param.name: p_oPointC
param.description: A Point3D of the second 3D line.

param.name: p_oPointD
param.description: Another Point3D of the second 3D line.

method.name: isPointInTriangle2D
method.description: Determines if a point is within a triangle.
method.shortDescription: Determines if a point is within a triangle.
method.result: Whether the point is inside the triangle.

param.name: p_oPoint
param.description: The point to find in the triangle.

param.name: p_oA
param.description: The first point of the triangle.

param.name: p_oB
param.description: The second point of the triangle.

param.name: p_oC
param.description: The third point of the triangle.

Creates a VertexMath object.

This is a singleton constructor, and should not be called directly.
If called from outside the ColorMath class, it throws a SingletonError.

[ToDo: Why instantiate this at all? - all methods are class methods! ]

Adds the two vertices.

[ToDo: Check here! We should add all the properties of the vertices! ]
method.shortDescription: Adds the two vertices.

method.description: Clones a vertex.

method.description: Computes the cross product the two vertices.
method.shortDescription: Computes the cross product the two vertices.

method.description: Computes the dot product of the two vertices.

Returns an instance of this class.

Call this method to get an instance of VertexMath.
method.shortDescription: Returns an instance of this class.

method.name: linearGradientMatrix
method.description:
Calculates linear gradient matrix from three vertices and ratios.

This function expects vertices to be ordered in such a way that p_nR0 < p_nR1 < p_n2. Ratios can be scaled by any positive factor.

See flash.display.Graphics.beginGradientFill() documentation for ratios meaning.
method.shortDescription: Calculates linear gradient matrix from three vertices and ratios.
method.result: The transformation matrix to use with beginGradientFill (GradientType.LINEAR only).

param.name: p_oV0
param.description: The leftmost vertex in a gradient.

param.name: p_oV1
param.description: The inner vertex in a gradient.

param.name: p_oV2
param.description: The rightmost vertex in a gradient.

param.name: p_nR0
param.description: The ratio for the leftmost vertext.

param.name: p_nR1
param.description: The ratio for the inner vertex.

method.name: negate
method.description:
Computes the opposite of a vertex.

The opposite vertex is a vertex where all components are multiplied by -1.
method.shortDescription: Computes the opposite of a vertex.

method.name: sub
method.description: Substracts one vertices from another.
method.shortDescription: Substracts one vertices from another.

Returns a classification constant depending on a Point3D's position relative to a plane.

The classification is one of PlaneMath.NEGATIVE, PlaneMath.POSITIVE, and PlaneMath.ON_PLANE.

Often before making some calculations with a plane you have to normalize it.
