asClass.name: BSphere
asClass.description:
The BSphere class is used to quickly and easily clip an object in a 3D scene.

It creates a bounding sphere that contains the whole object
asClass.shortDescription: The BSphere class is used to quickly and easily clip an object in a 3D scene.
asClass.author: Thomas Pfeiffer - kiroukou
asClass.example: This example is taken from the Shape3D class. It is used in the updateBoundingVolumes() method: _oBSphere = BSphere.create( m_oGeometry.aVertex );

method.name: compute
method.description: Computes of the bounding sphere's center and radius.
method.shortDescription: Computes of the bounding sphere's center and radius.

param.name: p_aVertices
param.description: The vertices of the 3D object the bounding sphere will contain.

method.name: create
method.description: Creates a bounding sphere that encloses a 3D from an Array of the object's vertices.
method.shortDescription: Creates a bounding sphere that encloses a 3D from an Array of the object's vertices.

param.name: p_aVertices
param.description: The vertices of the 3D object the bounding sphere will contain.

method.name: distance
method.description: Returns the distance of a Point3D from the surface of the bounding sphere. The number returned will be positive if the Point3D is outside the sphere, negative if inside, or 0 if on the surface of the sphere.
method.shortDescription: Returns the distance of a Point3D from the surface of the bounding sphere.
method.result: The distance from the bounding sphere to the Point3D.

method.name: reset
method.description: Reset the current bounding box to an empoty box with 0,0,0 as max and min values
method.shortDescription: Reset the current bounding box to an empoty box with 0,0,0 as max and min values

method.name: toString
method.description: Returns a string representation of this object.
method.shortDescription: Returns a string representation of this object.
method.result: The fully qualified name of this object.

method.name: transform
method.description: Applies a transformation to the bounding sphere.
method.shortDescription: Applies a transformation to the bounding sphere.

field.name: center
field.description: A Point3D representing the center of the bounding sphere.
field.shortDescription: A Point3D representing the center of the bounding sphere.

field.name: radius
field.description: The radius of the bounding sphere.
field.shortDescription: The radius of the bounding sphere.

field.name: uptodate
field.description: Specifies if this object's boundaries are up to date with the object it is enclosing. If false, this object's transform() method must be called to get its updated boundaries in the current frame.
field.shortDescription: Specifies if this object's boundaries are up to date with the object it is enclosing.

asClass.name: BBox
asClass.description:
The BBox class is used to quickly and easily clip an object in a 3D scene.

It creates a bounding box that contains the whole object.
asClass.shortDescription: The BBox class is used to quickly and easily clip an object in a 3D scene.
asClass.author: Thomas Pfeiffer - kiroukou
asClass.example: This example is taken from the Shape3D class. It is used in the updateBoundingVolumes() method: _oBBox = BBox.create( m_oGeometry.aVertex );

param.name: p_min
param.description: A Point3D representing the lowest point of the cube volume.

param.name: p_max
param.description: A Point3D representing the highest point of the cube volume.

method.description: Returns a new BBox object that is a clone of the original instance.
method.shortDescription: Returns a new BBox object that is a clone of the original instance.
method.result: A new BBox object that is identical to the original.

method.shortDescription: Creates a bounding box that encloses a 3D from an Array of the object's vertices.

param.name: p_aVertices
param.description: The vertices of the 3D object the bounding box will contain.

method.result: A Point3D object representing the size of the volume in three dimensions.

method.shortDescription: Merge the current BoundingBox with the one given in argument

method.description: Returns a string representation of this object.

asClass.name: Shape3DEvent
asClass.description: This class represents the type of events broadcasted by shapes objects. It gives some useful information about the clicked object such as the polygon clicked, and real 3D position of the point under mouse, the UV coordinate under mouse. It allows some advanced interaction with the object and its texture.
asClass.shortDescription: This class represents the type of events broadcasted by shapes objects.

field.shortDescription: The event target.

Example var e:Shape3DEvent = new Shape3DEvent(MyClass.onSomething, theShapeReference, thePolygonReference, theUVCoord, theReal3DIntersectionPoint);

asClass.name: Material
asClass.description:
The Material class is the base class for all materials.

Since the Material object is essentially a blank material, this class can be used to apply attributes without any material to a 3D object.
asClass.shortDescription: The Material class is the base class for all materials.
asClass.author: Thomas Pfeiffer - kiroukou

constructor.name: Material
constructor.description:
Creates a material.

This constructor is never called directly - but by sub class constructors.

method.name: begin
method.description: Calls begin method of the MaterialAttributes associated with this material.
method.shortDescription: Calls begin method of the MaterialAttributes associated with this material.

method.name: dispose
method.description: Method to call when you want to release the resources of that material (filters, attributes and lreferences to polygons) Shape3D.DEFAULT_MATERIAL Material can't be disposed because might be used for later shape3D creations
method.shortDescription: Method to call when you want to release the resources of that material (filters, attributes and lreferences to polygons) Shape3D.DEFAULT_MATERIAL Material can't be disposed because might be used for later shape3D creations

method.name: finish
method.description: Calls finish method of the MaterialAttributes associated with this material.
method.shortDescription: Calls finish method of the MaterialAttributes associated with this material.

method.name: init
method.description: Calls init method of the MaterialAttributes associated with this material.
method.shortDescription: Calls init method of the MaterialAttributes associated with this material.

method.name: renderPolygon
method.description:
Renders the polygon dress in this material.

Implemented by sub classes.
method.shortDescription: Renders the polygon dress in this material.

method.name: renderSprite
method.description:
Renders the sprite dress in this material.

Basically only needed to apply attributes to sprites
method.shortDescription: Renders the sprite dress in this material.

method.name: unlink
method.description: Calls unlink method of the MaterialAttributes associated with this material.
method.shortDescription: Calls unlink method of the MaterialAttributes associated with this material.

method.name: unlinkAll
method.description: Unlink all the non used polygons
method.shortDescription: Unlink all the non used polygons

field.name: attributes
field.description: The attributes of this material.
field.shortDescription: The attributes of this material.

field.name: autoDispose
field.description: Specifies if the material can automatically be disposed when unused Default value is to true
field.shortDescription: Specifies if the material can automatically be disposed when unused Default value is to true

field.name: lightingEnable
field.description: Specifies if the material can receive light and have light attributes applied to it. Can be useful to rapidly disable light on the object when unneeded.
field.shortDescription: Specifies if the material can receive light and have light attributes applied to it.

field.name: repeat
field.description:
The repeat property.
This affects the way textured materials are mapped for U or V out of 0-1 range.
field.shortDescription: The repeat property.

field.name: useVertexNormal
field.description: Specify if the material use the vertex normal information.
field.shortDescription: Specify if the material use the vertex normal information.

field.name: filters
field.description:
The array of filters for this material.

You use this property to add an array of filters you want to apply to this material
To remove the filters, just assign an empty array.
field.shortDescription: The array of filters for this material.

field.name: flags
field.description: Contains specific material flags.
field.shortDescription: Contains specific material flags.

field.name: id
field.description: The unique id of this material.
field.shortDescription: The unique id of this material.

field.name: modified
field.description:
The modified state of this material.

true if this material or its line attributes were modified since last rendered, false otherwise.
field.shortDescription: The modified state of this material.

field.name: type
field.description: The material type of this material.
field.shortDescription: The material type of this material.

asClass.name: Appearance
asClass.description:
Represents the appearance property of the visible objects.

The appearance holds the front and back materials of the object.
asClass.shortDescription: Represents the appearance property of the visible objects.
asClass.author: Thomas Pfeiffer - kiroukou

constructor.name: Appearance
constructor.description:
Creates an appearance with front and back materials.

If no material is passed, the default material for back and front is a default ColorMaterial.
If only a front material is passed, it will be used as back material as well.
constructor.shortDescription: Creates an appearance with front and back materials.

method.name: dispose
method.description: Dispose the front and back materials. Be careful, this may affect the other shapes that are using the same appearance or materials. References to front and back materials are set to null.
method.shortDescription: Dispose the front and back materials.

method.name: toString
method.description: Returns a string representation of this object.
method.shortDescription: Returns a string representation of this object.
method.result: The fully qualified name of this object.

field.name: backMaterial
field.description: The back material held by this appearance.
field.shortDescription: The back material held by this appearance.

field.name: flags
field.description: Returns the flags for the front and back materials.
field.shortDescription: Returns the flags for the front and back materials.

field.name: frontMaterial
field.description: The front material held by this appearance.
field.shortDescription: The front material held by this appearance.

field.name: lightingEnable
field.description: Return if the light has been enable on one of the 2 material (OR exclusion).
field.shortDescription: Return if the light has been enable on one of the 2 material (OR exclusion).

field.name: modified
field.description: Returns a boolean if the appearance has been modified and needs a redraw.
field.shortDescription: Returns a boolean if the appearance has been modified and needs a redraw.

field.name: useVertexNormal
field.description:
Get the use of vertex normal feature of the appearance.

Note: Only one of the materials is using this feature.
field.shortDescription: Get the use of vertex normal feature of the appearance.

constructor.name: VideoMaterial
constructor.description:
Creates a new VideoMaterial.

The video is converted to a bitmap to give it a perspective distortion.
To see the animation, the bitmap has to be recreated from the video on a regular basis.

param.name: p_oVideo
param.description: The video to be shown by this material.

method.name: start
method.description: Call this method when you want to start the material update. This is automatically called at the material creation so basically it is used only when the VideoMaterial::stop() method has been called
method.shortDescription: Call this method when you want to start the material update.

method.name: stop
method.description: Call this method is case you would like to stop the automatic video material graphics update.
method.shortDescription: Call this method is case you would like to stop the automatic video material graphics update.

method.name: update
method.description: Updates this material each internal timer cycle.
method.shortDescription: Updates this material each internal timer cycle.

field.name: DEFAULT_FILL_COLOR
field.description: Default color used to draw the bitmapdata content. In case you need a specific color, change this value at your application initialization.
field.shortDescription: Default color used to draw the bitmapdata content.

constructor.name: BitmapMaterial
constructor.description:
Creates a new BitmapMaterial.

Please note that we use internally a copy of the constructor bitmapdata. That means in case you need to access this bitmapdata, you can't just use the same reference but you shall use the BitmapMaterial#texture getter property to make it work.

param.name: p_nPrecision
param.description: The precision of this material. Using a precision with 0 makes the material behave as before. Then 1 as precision is very high and requires a lot of computation but proceed a the best perpective mapping correction. Bigger values are less CPU intensive but also less accurate. Usually a value of 5 is enough.

param.name: p_oPolygon
param.description: The face dressed by this material

method.name: setTiling
method.description: Sets texture tiling and optional offset. Tiling is applied first.
method.shortDescription: Sets texture tiling and optional offset.

method.name: setTransparency
method.description:
Changes the transparency of the texture.

The passed value is the percentage of opacity. Note that in order for this to work with animated texture, you need set material transparency every time after new texture frame is rendered.
method.shortDescription: Changes the transparency of the texture.

method.name: toString
method.description: Returns a string representation of this object.
method.shortDescription: Returns a string representation of this object.
method.result: The fully qualified name of this object.

field.name: maxRecurssionDepth
field.description: Maximum recurssion depth when using precision > 1 (which enables the perspective correction). The bigger the number is, the more accurate the result will be. Try to change this value to fits your needs to obtain the best performance.
field.shortDescription: Maximum recurssion depth when using precision > 1 (which enables the perspective correction).

field.name: precision
field.description: Precision of the bitmap mapping. This material uses an affine linear mapping. It results in a lack of accuracy at rendering time when the surface to draw is too big. One usual solution is to augment the number of polygon, but the performance cost can be quite big. Another solution is to change the precision property value. The lower the value, the more accurate the perspective correction is. To disable the perspective correction, set this property to zero, which is also the default value If you use the precision to solve the distortion issue, you can reduce the primitives quality (except if you are experiencing some sorting issues)
field.shortDescription: Precision of the bitmap mapping.

field.name: smooth
field.description: This property enables smooth bitmap rendering when set to true. The default value is set to false to have the best performance first. Enable this property have a performance impact, use it warefully
field.shortDescription: This property enables smooth bitmap rendering when set to true.

field.description: Indicates the alpha transparency value of the material. Valid values are 0 (fully transparent) to 1 (fully opaque).

constructor.name: MovieMaterial
constructor.description:
Creates a new MovieMaterial.

The MovieClip used for the material may contain animation.
It is converted to a bitmap to give it a perspective distortion.
To see the animation the bitmap has to be recreated from the MovieClip on a regular basis.

param.name: p_oMovie
param.description: The Movieclip to be shown by this material.

method.name: start
method.description: Call this method when you want to start the material update. This is automatically called at the material creation so basically it is used only when the MovieMaterial::stop() method has been called
method.shortDescription: Call this method when you want to start the material update.

method.name: stop
method.description: Call this method is case you would like to stop the automatic MovieMaterial texture update.
method.shortDescription: Call this method is case you would like to stop the automatic MovieMaterial texture update.

method.name: update
method.description: Updates this material each internal timer cycle.
method.shortDescription: Updates this material each internal timer cycle.

field.shortDescription: Default color used to draw the bitmapdata content.

field.description: Get the sprite used for the material.
field.shortDescription: Get the sprite used for the material.
